bugs.title: CVE-2019-12589 firejail: improper seccomp restrictions due to filters being writable inside the jail [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12589 firejail: improper seccomp restrictions due to filters being writable inside the jail [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12589 firejail: improper seccomp restrictions due to filters being writable inside the jail

long_desc.thetext:
In Firejail before 0.9.60, seccomp filters are writable inside the jail, leading to a lack of intended seccomp restrictions for a process that is joined to the jail after a filter has been modified by an attacker.


References:
https://github.com/netblue30/firejail/commit/eecf35c2f8249489a1d3e512bb07f0d427183134
https://github.com/netblue30/firejail/issues/2718
https://github.com/netblue30/firejail/releases/tag/0.9.60

Created firejail tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2019-12499 firejail: file descriptors command execution [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12499 firejail: file descriptors command execution [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12499 firejail: file descriptors command execution

long_desc.thetext:
Firejail before 0.9.60 allows truncation (resizing to length 0) of the firejail binary on the host by running exploit code inside a firejail sandbox and having the sandbox terminated. To succeed, certain conditions need to be fulfilled: The jail (with the exploit code inside) needs to be started as root, and it also needs to be terminated as root from the host (either by stopping it ungracefully (e.g., SIGKILL), or by using the --shutdown control command). This is similar to CVE-2019-5736.

Reference:
https://github.com/netblue30/firejail/issues/2401

Created firejail tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: [abrt] firejail: ioperm(): faudit killed by SIGSYS

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] firejail: ioperm(): faudit killed by SIGSYS

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Target file: an Appimage
Command executed:

$ firejail --appimage --private --noprofile --audit ./arduino
[...]
checking syscalls: mount... umount2... ptrace... swapon... swapoff... init_module... delete_module... chroot... pivot_root... iopl... ioperm... 
[...]

As a result, out of all eleven ABRT reports are produced including the present one. They each occured along with those eleven mentioned reported after "checking syscalls:".

Version-Release number of selected component:
firejail-0.9.56-9.fc31

Additional info:
reporter:       libreport-2.11.3
backtrace_rating: 4
cgroup:         0::/user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service/gnome-terminal-server.service
cmdline:        /usr/lib64/firejail/faudit syscall ioperm
crash_function: ioperm
executable:     /usr/lib64/firejail/faudit
journald_cursor: s=ae506c4adbb24ab1b96d08a3e34b0254;i=b50;b=b226ed4333f64218b71da894e7b1ef22;m=c3e35d16;t=599bd51c174f2;x=cc378ad17c306acc
kernel:         5.3.16-300.fc31.x86_64
rootdir:        /
runlevel:       N 5
type:           CCpp
uid:            1000

Truncated backtrace:
Thread no. 1 (2 frames)
 #0 ioperm at ../sysdeps/unix/syscall-template.S:78
 #1 syscall_helper at syscall.c:84

Created attachment 1649959
File: backtrace

Created attachment 1649960
File: core_backtrace

Created attachment 1649961
File: cpuinfo

Created attachment 1649962
File: dso_list

Created attachment 1649963
File: environ

Created attachment 1649964
File: limits

Created attachment 1649965
File: maps

Created attachment 1649966
File: mountinfo

Created attachment 1649967
File: open_fds

Created attachment 1649968
File: proc_pid_status
Firejail was rebased to 0.9.62 in fedora-all, the problem should be resolved.

bugs.title: Error mounting appimage: appimage.c:119 appimage_set: Invalid argument

bugzilla.short_desc: Error mounting appimage: appimage.c:119 appimage_set: Invalid argument

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Currently shipped with Fedora-31 filejail-0.9.56 is not compatible with current kernel-5.4.17 thus making firejail completely unusable for appimage type 2.
The problem should be resolved, as fedora-all was rebased to version 0.9.62.
